intro: Ammannia arnhemica, commonly known as the Northern River Spinifex, is a flowering plant native to northern Australia. It belongs to the family Nyctaginaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils along riverbanks and in seasonally wet areas. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, spiky fruits that are dispersed by wind. Ammannia arnhemica is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
